trans-unit.source: At this point, the new host should be synchronizing with the secondary back-end server. The secondary back-end server will forget all about the data it was missing from the now-gone primary back-end server, and the process of bringing the Chef server back online can begin.
trans-unit.target: 此时,新主机应该会与辅助后台服务器进行同步。二级后端服务器会忘记现在消失的主后端服务器所丢失的所有数据,然后就可以开始让Chef服务器重新上线的过程。

trans-unit.target: 此时，仅授权用户 sean_horn 和 angle 读取和管理库。

trans-unit.source: Atomic updates are enabled by default. They can be managed globally using the file_atomic_update setting in the client.rb file. They can be managed on a per-resource basis using the atomic_update property that is available with the cookbook_file, file, remote_file, and template resources.
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下启用原子更新。可以使用client.rb文件中的 file_atomic_update 设置对它们进行全局管理。可以使用cookbook_file，file，remote_file和模板资源提供的 atomic_update 属性按资源对它们进行管理。

trans-unit.source: Atomic updates are used with file-based resources to help ensure that file updates can be made when updating a binary or if disk space runs out.
trans-unit.target: 原子更新与基于文件的资源一起使用，以帮助确保在更新二进制文件或磁盘空间用尽时可以进行文件更新。

Failover is achieved using:

trans-unit.source: Bookshelf is used to store cookbook content—files, templates, and so on—that have been uploaded to the Chef server as part of a cookbook version. Cookbook content is stored by content checksum. If two different cookbooks or different versions of the same cookbook include the same file or template, Bookshelf will store that file only once. The cookbook content managed by Bookshelf is stored in flat files and is separated from the Chef server and search index repositories.
trans-unit.target: 书架用于存储食谱内容（文件，模板等），这些内容已作为食谱版本的一部分上载到Chef服务器。食谱内容按内容校验和存储。如果两个不同的食谱或同一食谱的不同版本包含相同的文件或模板，则书架将仅将该文件存储一次。书架管理的食谱内容存储在平面文件中，并与Chef服务器和搜索索引存储库分开。

The deep merge capabilities of the chef-client allows attributes to be layered across cookbooks, recipes, roles, and environments. trans-unit.source: By combining wildcards with range-matching patterns and wildcard queries, it is possible to perform very powerful searches, such as using the vendor part of the MAC address to find every node that has a network card made by the specified vendor.

trans-unit.source: By default, a file or directory inherits rights from its parent directory. Most of the time this is the preferred behavior, but sometimes it may be necessary to take steps to more specifically control rights. The inherits property can be used to specifically tell the chef-client to apply (or not apply) inherited rights from its parent directory.
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下，文件或目录从其父目录继承权限。在大多数情况下，这是首选的行为，但有时可能需要采取步骤以更具体地控制权限。在 inherits 财产可以用来明确告诉厨师，客户端应用（或不适用）从它的父目录继承的权限。

trans-unit.source: By default, a partial template file is assumed to be located in the cookbook that contains the top-level template. Use this option to specify the path to a different cookbook
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下,部分模板文件被认为位于包含顶层模板的cookbook中。使用该选项可以指定不同的cookbook的路径。

trans-unit.source: By default, a partial template file is identified by its file name. Use this option to specify a different name or a local path to use (instead of the name of the partial template file)
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下,部分模板文件由其文件名识别。使用该选项可以指定不同的名称或本地路径(而不是部分模板文件的名称)。

trans-unit.source: By default, accounts required by the Chef server are created during setup. If your environment has restrictions on the creation of local user and group accounts that will prevent these accounts from being created automatically during setup, you will need to create these accounts.
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下,Chef服务器所需的账户是在设置期间创建的。如果您的环境对创建本地用户和组账户有限制,使这些账户无法在设置期间自动创建,您将需要创建这些账户。

trans-unit.source: By default, chef-shell loads in standalone mode and does not connect to the Chef server. The chef-shell can be run as a chef-client to verify functionality that is only available when the chef-client connects to the Chef server, such as search functionality or accessing data stored in data bags.
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下,chef-shell以独立模式加载,不连接到Chef服务器。chef-shell可以作为chef客户端运行,以验证只有当chef客户端连接到Chef服务器时才能使用的功能,例如搜索功能或访问数据袋中存储的数据。

trans-unit.source: By default, every log resource that executes will count as an updated resource in the updated resource count at the end of a Chef run. You can disable this behavior by adding count_log_resource_updates false to your Chef client.rb configuration file.
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下，每一次执行的日志资源都将在Chef运行结束时计为已更新资源计数中的已更新资源。您可以通过在您的Chef client.rb 配置文件中添加 count_log_resource_updates false 来禁用此行为。

trans-unit.source: Chef Analytics uses the same RabbitMQ service that is configured on the Chef server. When the Chef Analytics server is configured as a standalone server, the default settings for rabbitmq['node_ip_address'] and rabbitmq['vip'] must be updated. When the Chef Analytics server is configured as a standalone server, change this value to 0.0.0.0.
trans-unit.target: Chef Analytics使用与Chef服务器上配置的RabbitMQ服务相同的服务。将Chef Analytics服务器配置为独立服务器时，必须更新 rabbitmq['node_ip_address'] 和 rabbitmq['vip'] 的默认设置。当Chef Analytics服务器配置为独立服务器时，将此值更改为 0.0.0.0 。

trans-unit.source: Chef Analytics uses the same RabbitMQ service that is configured on the Chef server. When the Chef Analytics server is configured as a standalone server, the default settings for rabbitmq['node_ip_address'] and rabbitmq['vip'] must be updated. When the Chef Analytics server is configured as a standalone server, change this value to the backend VIP address for the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Chef Analytics使用与Chef服务器上配置的RabbitMQ服务相同的服务。将Chef Analytics服务器配置为独立服务器时，必须更新 rabbitmq['node_ip_address'] 和 rabbitmq['vip'] 的默认设置。当Chef Analytics服务器配置为独立服务器时，将此值更改为Chef服务器的后端VIP地址。

trans-unit.source: Chef Analytics uses the same RabbitMQ service that is configured on the Chef server. When the Chef Analytics server is configured as a standalone server, the default settings for rabbitmq['node_ip_address'] and rabbitmq['vip'] must be updated. When the Chef Analytics server is configured as a standalone server, this value should be updated to be the backend VIP address for the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Chef Analytics使用与Chef服务器上配置的RabbitMQ服务相同的服务。将Chef Analytics服务器配置为独立服务器时，必须更新 rabbitmq['node_ip_address'] 和 rabbitmq['vip'] 的默认设置。当Chef Analytics服务器配置为独立服务器时，此值应更新为Chef服务器的后端VIP地址。

trans-unit.source: Chef Supermarket is the location in which community cookbooks are authored and maintained. Cookbooks that are part of the Chef Supermarket may be used by any Chef user. How community cookbooks are used varies from organization to organization.

trans-unit.source: Chef has many built-in resources that cover all of the most common actions across all of the most common platforms. You can build your own resources for handle any situation that isn’t covered by a built-in resource.
trans-unit.target: Chef具有许多内置资源，涵盖了所有最常见平台上的所有最常见动作。您可以构建自己的资源来处理内置资源未涵盖的任何情况。

trans-unit.source: Chef has the following major components:
trans-unit.target: 厨师有以下主要组成部分。

trans-unit.source: Chef includes two important command-line tools:
trans-unit.target: Chef包括两个重要的命令行工具。

trans-unit.source: Chef is a powerful automation platform that transforms infrastructure into code. Whether you’re operating in the cloud, on-premises, or in a hybrid environment, Chef automates how infrastructure is configured, deployed, and managed across your network, no matter its size.
trans-unit.target: Chef是一个功能强大的自动化平台，可将基础架构转换为代码。无论您是在云中，本地还是混合环境中进行操作，Chef都会自动在整个网络中自动配置，部署和管理基础架构，无论其规模如何。

trans-unit.source: Chef is a thin DSL (domain-specific language) built on top of Ruby. This approach allows Chef to provide just enough abstraction to make reasoning about your infrastructure easy. Chef includes a built-in taxonomy of all the basic resources one might configure on a system, plus a defined mechanism to extend that taxonomy using the full power of the Ruby language. Ruby was chosen because it provides the flexibility to use both the simple built-in taxonomy, as well as being able to handle any customization path your organization requires.
trans-unit.target: Chef是一个建立在Ruby之上的瘦DSL(特定领域语言)。这种方法使Chef能够提供足够的抽象,使你的基础设施的推理变得简单。Chef包含了一个内置的分类法,它包含了一个系统上所有可能配置的基本资源,还有一个定义的机制来使用Ruby语言的全部功能来扩展这个分类法。之所以选择Ruby,是因为它既能灵活地使用简单的内置分类法,又能处理组织所需的任何定制路径。

trans-unit.source: Chef is maintained on GitHub. To contribute to Chef, such as submitting a pull request, requires using GitHub and git. The sections below describe how to use git to set up the Chef repository, keep it current and synchronized, and how to use branches to submit pull requests.
trans-unit.target: Chef是在GitHub上维护的。要为Chef做出贡献,比如提交一个拉取请求,需要使用GitHub和git。下面的章节将介绍如何使用 git 来设置 Chef 仓库,保持仓库的更新和同步,以及如何使用分支来提交拉取请求。

trans-unit.source: Chef maintains a collection of cookbooks that are widely used by the community.
trans-unit.target: 厨师维护着一本被社会广泛使用的烹饪书。

trans-unit.source: Chef maintains a large collection of cookbooks. In addition, there are thousands of cookbooks created and maintained by the community:
trans-unit.target: 厨师维护着大量的烹饪书。此外,还有数千本由社区创建和维护的烹饪书。

trans-unit.source: Chef management console can be upgraded as part of a standalone or high availability configuration:
trans-unit.target: Chef管理控制台可以作为独立或高可用性配置的一部分进行升级。

trans-unit.source: Chef management console is a web-based interface for the Chef server that provides users a way to manage the following objects:
trans-unit.target: Chef管理控制台是一个基于Web的界面,为用户提供管理以下对象的方法。

trans-unit.source: Chef management console is the user interface for the Chef server. It is used to manage data bags, attributes, run-lists, roles, environments, and cookbooks, and also to configure role-based access for users and groups.
trans-unit.target: Chef管理控制台是Chef服务器的用户界面。它用于管理数据袋、属性、运行列表、角色、环境和烹饪书,还可以为用户和组配置基于角色的访问。

trans-unit.source: Chef on Nodes

trans-unit.source: Chef provides the following plugins, which work the same as built-in subcommands (including common options), but must be installed separately (using RubyGems): knife azure, knife bluebox, knife ec2, knife eucalyptus, knife google, knife linode, knife openstack, knife rackspace, knife terremark, knife vcloud, and knife windows.
trans-unit.target: Chef提供以下插件，其功能与内置子命令（包括通用选项）相同，但必须单独安装（使用RubyGems）： knife azure ， knife bluebox 蓝盒， knife ec2 ， knife eucalyptus ， knife google ， knife linode ， knife openstack ， knife rackspace ， knife terremark ， knife vcloud 和 knife windows 。

trans-unit.source: Chef push jobs can be upgraded as part of a standalone or high availability configuration:
trans-unit.target: Chef推送作业可以作为独立或高可用性配置的一部分进行升级。

trans-unit.source: Chef push jobs is an extension of the Chef server that allows jobs to be run against nodes independently of a chef-client run. A job is an action or a command to be executed against a subset of nodes; the nodes against which a job is run are determined by the results of a search query made to the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Chef push jobs是Chef服务器的一个扩展,它允许独立于chef-客户端运行的节点运行作业。作业是针对一个节点子集执行的动作或命令;作业所针对的节点由向Chef服务器进行搜索查询的结果决定。

trans-unit.source: Chef push jobs uses the Chef server API and a Ruby client to initiate all connections to the Chef server. Connections use the same authentication and authorization model as any other request made to the Chef server. A knife plugin is used to initiate job creation and job tracking.
trans-unit.target: Chef推送作业使用Chef服务器API和Ruby客户端来启动所有与Chef服务器的连接。连接使用与任何其他向Chef服务器发出的请求相同的认证和授权模型。一个小刀插件用于启动作业创建和作业跟踪。

trans-unit.target: 厨师建议使用单个虚拟机实例

trans-unit.target: 厨师建议聘请厨师专业服务机构帮助进行这种规模的能力和建筑规划。

trans-unit.source: Chef recommends two hosts, one front-end and one back-end

trans-unit.source: Chef server 12 enables SSL verification by default for all requests made to the server, such as those made by knife and the chef-client. The certificate that is generated during the installation of the Chef server is self-signed, which means the certificate is not signed by a trusted certificate authority (CA) that ships with the chef-client. The certificate generated by the Chef server must be downloaded to any machine from which knife and/or the chef-client will make requests to the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: Chef服务器12默认为所有向服务器发出的请求启用SSL验证,例如刀子和chef-client发出的请求。在安装Chef服务器期间生成的证书是自签名的,这意味着该证书不是由与chef客户端一起运送的受信任的证书机构(CA)签署的。廚師伺服器產生的證書必須下載到任何一台刀和/或廚師客戶端向廚師伺服器提出請求的機器上。

trans-unit.source: Chef server 12 enables SSL verification by default for all requests made to the server, such as those made by knife and the chef-client. The certificate that is generated during the installation of the Chef server is self-signed, which means there isn’t a signing certificate authority (CA) to verify. In addition, this certificate must be downloaded to any machine from which knife and/or the chef-client will make requests to the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: 厨师服务器12默认启用对服务器发出的所有请求（例如，刀和厨师客户端发出的请求）的SSL验证。在Chef服务器安装过程中生成的证书是自签名的，这意味着没有要验证的签名证书颁发机构（CA）。此外，该证书必须下载到刀和/或厨师客户从中向厨师服务器发出请求的任何机器上。

trans-unit.source: Chef server 12 is installed to /opt/opscode. (The existing Open Source Chef remains at /opt/chef-server.) From this point, the chef-server-ctl commands are running against the /opt/opscode location.
trans-unit.target: Chef服务器12安装到 /opt/opscode 。（现有的开放源代码Chef保留在 /opt/chef-server 。）至此， chef-server-ctl 命令在 /opt/opscode 位置运行。

trans-unit.source: Chef strongly recommends using some type of version control tool to manage the source code in the chef-repo. Chef uses git for everything, including for cookbooks. git and/or GitHub is not required to use Chef. If another version source control system is preferred over git (such as Subversion, Mercurial, or Bazaar) that is just fine.
trans-unit.target: Chef强烈建议使用某种类型的版本控制工具来管理chef-repo中的源代码。Chef使用git来处理所有事情,包括烹饪书。使用Chef不需要git和/或GitHub。如果比git更喜欢其他版本源码控制系统(如Subversion、Mercurial或Bazaar),那也可以。

trans-unit.source: Chef uses MD5 hashes to uniquely identify files that are stored on the Chef server. MD5 is used only to generate a unique hash identifier and is not used for any cryptographic purpose.
trans-unit.target: Chef 使用 MD5 哈希值来唯一地识别存储在 Chef 服务器上的文件。MD5仅用于生成唯一的散列标识,不用于任何加密目的。

During installation, the high-availability plugin will automatically assign the VIP to the elastic network interface (ENI) for the primary instance.

trans-unit.source: Commits to the Chef repositories should never be made against the master branch. Use a topic branch instead. A topic branch solves a single and unique problem and often maps closely to an issue being tracked in the repository. For example, a topic branch to add support for a new init system or a topic branch to resolve a bug that occurs in a specific version of CentOS. Ideally, a topic branch is named in a way that associates it closely with the issue it is attempting to resolve. This helps ensure that others may easily find it.
trans-unit.target: 对 Chef 资源库的提交不应该针对主分支进行。使用主题分支来代替。主题分支解决的是一个单一且独特的问题,并且通常与版本库中正在跟踪的问题密切相关。例如,一个主题分支可以为新的 init 系统添加支持,或者一个主题分支可以解决 CentOS 特定版本中出现的 bug。理想情况下,主题分支的命名方式应该与它试图解决的问题密切相关。这有助于确保其他人很容易找到它。

trans-unit.source: Contain the chef-client run in a secondary process with dedicated RAM. When the chef-client run is complete, the RAM is returned to the master process. This option helps ensure that a chef-client uses a steady amount of RAM over time because the master process does not run recipes. This option also helps prevent memory leaks such as those that can be introduced by the code contained within a poorly designed cookbook. Use --no-fork to disable running the chef-client in fork node. Default value: --fork.
trans-unit.target: 通过专用RAM包含在辅助进程中运行的Chef-Client。Chef-client运行完成后，RAM返回到主进程。此选项有助于确保厨师客户端随时间推移使用稳定数量的RAM，因为主进程不会运行配方。此选项还有助于防止内存泄漏，例如设计不佳的食谱中包含的代码可能导致的内存泄漏。使用 --no-fork 禁用在fork节点中运行Chef-client。默认值：-- --fork 。

trans-unit.source: Contain the chef-client run in a secondary process with dedicated RAM. When the chef-client run is complete, the RAM is returned to the master process. This option helps ensure that a chef-client uses a steady amount of RAM over time because the master process does not run recipes. This option also helps prevent memory leaks such as those that can be introduced by the code contained within a poorly designed cookbook. Use --no-fork to disable running the chef-client in fork node. Default value: --fork. This option may not be used in the same command with the --daemonize and --interval options.
trans-unit.target: 通过专用RAM包含在辅助进程中运行的Chef-Client。 Chef-client运行完成后，RAM返回到主进程。此选项有助于确保厨师客户端随时间推移使用稳定数量的RAM，因为主进程不会运行配方。此选项还有助于防止内存泄漏，例如设计不佳的食谱中包含的代码可能导致的内存泄漏。使用 --no-fork 禁用在fork节点中运行Chef-client。默认值：-- --fork 。此选项可能无法与 --daemonize 和 --interval 选项在同一命令中使用。

trans-unit.source: Containers are an approach to virtualization that allows a single operating system to host many working configurations, where each working configuration—a container—is assigned a single responsibility that is isolated from all other responsibilities. Containers are popular as a way to manage distributed and scalable applications and services.
trans-unit.target: 容器是一种虚拟化方法，它允许单个操作系统托管许多工作配置，其中为每个工作配置（一个容器）分配了与所有其他职责隔离的单个职责。容器作为管理分布式和可伸缩应用程序和服务的一种方式而流行。

trans-unit.source: Controls the phase during which a gem is installed on a node. Set to true to install a gem while the resource collection is being built (the “compile phase”). Set to false to install a gem while the chef-client is configuring the node (the “converge phase”). Possible values: nil (for verbose warnings), true (to warn once per chef-client run), or false (to remove all warnings). Recommended value: false.
trans-unit.target: 控制在节点上安装gem的阶段。设置为 true 以在构建资源集合时安装gem（“编译阶段”）。设置为 false 可在Chef客户端配置节点时安装gem（“融合阶段”）。可能的值： nil （用于详细警告）， true （在每次厨师客户运行时警告一次）或 false （用于删除所有警告）。推荐值： false 。

trans-unit.source: Controls the phase during which a gem is installed on a node. Set to true to install a gem while the resource collection is being built (the “compile phase”). trans-unit.source: DRBD This port range must be open between all back end servers in a high availability configuration that uses DRBD.

trans-unit.source: DRBD can be configured to utilize more bandwidth during the initial synchronization. For Red Hat and CentOS 6:
trans-unit.target: DRBD可以被配置为在初始同步期间利用更多的带宽。对于Red Hat和CentOS 6。

trans-unit.source: DRBD configuration allows for custom handlers when a split-brain event happens. The basic handler sends a notification email to a configurable email address so the issue can be investigated.
trans-unit.target: 当发生 split-brain 事件时，DRBD配置允许自定义处理程序。基本处理程序将通知电子邮件发送到可配置的电子邮件地址，以便可以调查此问题。

trans-unit.source: DRBD is a shared-nothing system. Data is replicated between hosts over a dedicated network link rather than stored on a central network-attached storage (NAS) or storage attached network (SAN) to which all hosts are connected. The most critical issue for storage in a high availability topology is loss of or corruption of data. Maximizing the amount of data that can be passed over the wire while all systems are up and running correctly minimizes the chance that something will be lost or unrecoverable if a host goes down.
trans-unit.target: DRBD是一个共享无的系统。数据通过专用网络链路在主机之间复制,而不是存储在所有主机都连接的中央网络附加存储(NAS)或存储附加网络(SAN)上。高可用性拓扑中存储最关键的问题是数据丢失或损坏。在所有系统都正常运行的情况下,最大限度地增加可以通过线路传递的数据量,可以最大限度地减少主机宕机时丢失或无法恢复的可能性。

trans-unit.source: DRBD is a supported high availability configuration option for the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: DRBD 是 Chef 服务器支持的高可用性配置选项。

trans-unit.source: DRBD may be resized. First, make a backup of the Chef server data.
trans-unit.target: DRBD可以调整大小。首先,对Chef服务器的数据进行备份。

trans-unit.source: DRBD on the first back-end server will sync to the second back-end server and will become the clean secondary FQDN.
trans-unit.target: 第一台后端服务器上的DRBD将同步到第二台后端服务器上,成为干净的二级FQDN。

trans-unit.source: Debian and Apt

trans-unit.source: Debian platform only. The relative priority of the program for start and shutdown ordering. May be an integer or a Hash. An integer is used to define the start run levels; stop run levels are then 100-integer. A Hash is used to define values for specific run levels. For example, { 2 => [:start, 20], 3 => [:stop, 55] } will set a priority of twenty for run level two and a priority of fifty-five for run level three.
trans-unit.target: 仅限于Debian平台。用于启动和关闭顺序的程序的相对优先级。可以是整数或哈希。整数用于定义开始运行级别；然后将停止运行级别设置为100整数。哈希用于定义特定运行级别的值。例如， { 2 => [:start, 20], 3 => [:stop, 55] } 将为运行级别2设置优先级为20，为运行级别3设置优先级为55。

trans-unit.source: Desired State Configuration (DSC) is a feature of Windows PowerShell that provides a set of language extensions, cmdlets, and resources that can be used to declaratively configure software. DSC is similar to Chef, in that both tools are idempotent, take similar approaches to the concept of resources, describe the configuration of a system, and then take the steps required to do that configuration. The most important difference between Chef and DSC is that Chef uses Ruby and DSC is exposed as configuration data from within Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: 所需状态配置（DSC）是Windows PowerShell的一项功能，它提供了一组语言扩展，cmdlet和资源，可用于以声明方式配置软件。DSC与Chef相似，因为这两个工具都是幂等的，对资源的概念采用相似的方法，描述系统的配置，然后采取进行该配置所需的步骤。Chef和DSC之间最重要的区别是Chef使用Ruby，并且DSC作为Windows PowerShell中的配置数据公开。

trans-unit.source: During a chef-client run, the checksum for each local file is calculated and then compared against the checksum for the same file as it currently exists in the cookbook on the Chef server. A file is not transferred when the checksums match. Only files that require an update are transferred from the Chef server to a node.
trans-unit.target: 在 chef 客户端运行过程中,计算每个本地文件的校验和,然后与 chef 服务器上食谱中当前存在的同一文件的校验和进行比较。当校验和匹配时,文件不会被传输。只有需要更新的文件才会从Chef服务器传输到节点。

Default value: true.
trans-unit.target: 启用或禁用将事件发送到Microsoft Windows“应用程序”事件日志。如果为 false ，则在厨师客户端运行的开始和结束以及厨师客户端运行失败的情况下，事件会发送到Microsoft Windows“应用程序”事件日志。设置为 true 以禁用事件日志记录。默认值： true 。

trans-unit.source: Entirely remove a cookbook (or cookbook version) from the Chef server. Use this action carefully because only one copy of any single file is stored on the Chef server. Consequently, purging a cookbook disables any other cookbook that references one or more files from the cookbook that has been purged.
trans-unit.target: 从Chef服务器上完全删除一本食谱(或食谱版本)。小心使用此動作,因為任何單一檔案的複本都只儲存在 Chef 伺服器上,因此,清除一本cookbook會使任何引用已清除cookbook中一個或多個檔案的其他cookbook失效。因此,清除一本食谱会使任何引用被清除的食谱中的一个或多个文件的其他食谱失效。

trans-unit.source: Erchef is a complete rewrite of the core API for the Chef server, which allows it to be faster and more scalable than previous versions. The API itself is still compatible with the original Ruby-based Chef server, which means that cookbooks and recipes that were authored for the Ruby-based Chef server will continue to work on the Erlang-based Chef server. The chef-client is still written in Ruby.
trans-unit.target: Erchef是对Chef服务器的核心API的完全重写,这使得它比以前的版本更快,扩展性更强。API本身仍然与原来基于Ruby的Chef服务器兼容,这意味着为基于Ruby的Chef服务器编写的烹饪书和食谱将继续在基于Erlang的Chef服务器上工作。厨师客户端仍然是用Ruby编写的。

trans-unit.source: Event handlers are not specifically part of the Recipe DSL. An event handler is declared using the Chef.event_hander method, which declares the event handler within recipes in a similar manner to other Recipe DSL methods.
trans-unit.target: 事件处理程序不是Recipe DSL的特定组成部分。使用声明事件处理程序 Chef.event_hander 方法声明事件处理程序，该方法以与其他Recipe DSL方法类似的方式在配方中声明事件处理程序。

trans-unit.source: Event messages can be sent to a team communication tool like HipChat. For example, if a chef-client run fails:
trans-unit.target: 事件消息可以发送到HipChat等团队通讯工具上。例如,如果一个厨师客户端运行失败。

trans-unit.source: Eventually the hosts will quiesce and report ds:UpToDate/UpToDate. Depending on how long the secondary was down, how much data was written to the primary in the interim, and the speed of the shared network, this process could be nearly instantaneous, or could take several minutes. The processes used to manage the Chef server should not require manipulation in any way during this recovery.
trans-unit.target: 最终，主持人将停顿并报告 ds:UpToDate/UpToDate 。根据辅助节点停机的时间，过渡期间向主节点写入的数据量以及共享网络的速度，此过程可能几乎是瞬时的，也可能需要几分钟。在此恢复过程中，用于管理Chef服务器的进程无需进行任何操作。

trans-unit.source: Every cookbook requires a small amount of metadata. A file named metadata.rb is located at the top of every cookbook directory structure. The contents of the metadata.rb file provides hints to the Chef server to help ensure that cookbooks are deployed to each node correctly.
trans-unit.target: 每本烹饪书都需要少量的元数据。一个名为metadata.rb的文件位于每个cookbook目录结构的顶部。metadata.rb文件的内容为Chef服务器提供提示,以帮助确保cookbook正确地部署到每个节点。

trans-unit.source: Every request made by the chef-client to the Chef server must be an authenticated request using the Chef server API and a private key. When the chef-client makes a request to the Chef server, the chef-client authenticates each request using a private key located in /etc/chef/client.pem.
trans-unit.target: Chef客户端对Chef服务器的每个请求都必须是使用Chef服务器API和私钥进行的经过身份验证的请求。当厨师客户端向厨师服务器发出请求时，厨师客户端使用位于以下位置的私钥对每个请求进行身份验证 /etc/chef/client.pem 中。

trans-unit.source: Every resource has its own set of actions and properties. Most properties have default values. Some properties are available to all resources, for example those used to send notifications to other resources and guards that help ensure that some resources are idempotent.
trans-unit.target: 每个资源都有自己的动作和属性集。大多数属性都有默认值。有些属性对所有资源都是可用的,例如那些用于向其他资源发送通知的属性,以及有助于确保某些资源为幂等资源的守卫。

trans-unit.target: 编写食谱并将其上传到Chef服务器所需的其他一切。

trans-unit.source: Exception and report handlers can be distributed using the chef_handler cookbook. This cookbook is authored and maintained by Chef and exposes a custom resource that can be used to enable custom handlers from within recipes and to include product-specific handlers from cookbooks. The chef_handler cookbook can be accessed here: https://github.com/chef-cookbooks/chef_handler. See the README.md for additional information.

trans-unit.source: Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) is a United States government computer security standard that specifies security requirements for cryptography. The current version of the standard is FIPS 140-2. The chef-client can be configured to allow OpenSSL to enforce FIPS-validated security during a chef-client run. This will disable cryptography that is explicitly disallowed in FIPS-validated software, including certain ciphers and hashing algorithms. Any attempt to use any disallowed cryptography will cause the chef-client to throw an exception during a chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: 联邦信息处理标准(FIPS)是美国政府的计算机安全标准,规定了密码学的安全要求。该标准的当前版本是FIPS 140-2。chef-client可以被配置为允许OpenSSL在chef-client运行过程中执行FIPS验证的安全。这将禁用在FIPS验证软件中明确不允许的加密技术,包括某些密码和哈希算法。任何试图使用任何不允许的加密技术都会导致厨师客户端在厨师客户端运行期间抛出一个异常。

trans-unit.source: For not_if and only_if attribute, why-run mode will assume these are commands or blocks that are safe to run. These conditions are not designed to be used to change the state of the system, but rather to help facilitate idempotency for the resource itself. That said, it may be possible that these attributes are being used in a way that modifies the system state
trans-unit.target: 对于 not_if 和 only_if 属性，为什么运行模式将假定这些是可以安全运行的命令或块。这些条件并非旨在用于更改系统状态，而是有助于促进资源本身的幂等性。也就是说，这些属性可能以修改系统状态的方式使用

trans-unit.source: For example, the web.rb references the baseline.rb role. The web.rb file only provides a value for one attribute: :startservers. When the chef-client compares these attributes, the deep merge feature will ensure that :startservers (and its value of 30) will be applied to any node for which the web.rb attribute structure should be applied.
trans-unit.target: 例如， web.rb 引用了 baseline.rb 角色。该 web.rb 文件只为一个属性提供一个值： :startservers 。当Chef-client比较这些属性时，深度合并功能将确保 :startservers （及其值 30 ）将应用于应应用 web.rb 属性结构的任何节点。

trans-unit.source: For example, the service resource can be used to start a service. If the action is :start and the service is not running, then start the service (if it is not running) and do nothing (if it is running). What about a service that is installed from a package? The chef-client cannot check to see if the service is running until after the package is installed. A simple question that why-run mode can answer is what the chef-client would say about the state of the service after installing the package because service actions often trigger notifications to other resources. So it can be important to know in advance that any notifications are being triggered correctly.
trans-unit.target: 例如，服务资源可用于启动服务。如果操作是 :start 并且服务未运行，则启动服务（如果服务未运行），而不执行任何操作（如果服务正在运行）。从软件包安装的服务怎么样？在安装软件包之前，chef-client无法检查服务是否正在运行。运行模式为何可以回答的一个简单问题是，主厨客户端会在安装软件包后对服务状态说些什么，因为服务操作通常会触发对其他资源的通知。因此，重要的是要事先知道所有通知均已正确触发。

trans-unit.source: For instance, if there are West coast and East coast data centers, it is best to have one Chef server instance in each datacenter. Deploys to each Chef server can be synchronized upstream by CI software. The primary limiting bottleneck for Chef server installations is almost always input/output operations per second (IOPS) performance for the database filesystem.
trans-unit.target: 例如,如果有西海岸和东海岸的数据中心,最好在每个数据中心都有一个Chef服务器实例。部署到每个Chef服务器上的数据可以通过CI软件进行上游同步。Chef服务器安装的主要限制瓶颈几乎都是数据库文件系统的每秒输入/输出操作(IOPS)性能。

trans-unit.source: For the chef-client, two important aspects of nodes are groups of attributes and run-lists. An attribute is a specific piece of data about the node, such as a network interface, a file system, the number of clients a service running on a node is capable of accepting, and so on. A run-list is an ordered list of recipes and/or roles that are run in an exact order. The node object consists of the run-list and node attributes, which is a JSON file that is stored on the Chef server. The chef-client gets a copy of the node object from the Chef server during each chef-client run and places an updated copy on the Chef server at the end of each chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: 对于厨师客户端来说,节点的两个重要方面是属性组和运行列表。属性是关于节点的特定数据,比如网络接口、文件系统、节点上运行的服务能够接受的客户端数量等等。运行列表是一个有序的配方和/或角色的列表,这些配方和/或角色是按照准确的顺序运行的。节点对象由运行列表和节点属性组成,它是一个JSON文件,存储在Chef服务器上。廚師客戶端在每次廚師客戶端執行時,會從 Chef 伺服器取得節點物件的複本,並在每次廚師客戶端執行結束時,將更新的複本放在 Chef 伺服器上。
